mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Tyler, Robert, 1816-1877
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Asks Gardiner to see that a speech he has written is published; has heard from the Ex-President and Mrs. Tyler who are both doing well; "He says something about some expression used in one of my letters that has annoyed Julia. I have written him that it was altogether unintentioned, Madame Julia is too sensitive"; tells David [Gardiner] and him to get married. Autograph Letter Signed
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1846 March 23, Robert Tyler to Alexander Gardiner, New York, N.Y.
